text: The Philadelphia Phillies' 1981 season was a season in American baseball. == Offseason == * November 25, 1980: Rick Schu was signed as an amateur free agent by the Phillies.Rick Schu at Baseball Reference * December 8, 1980: George Bell was drafted from the Phillies by the Toronto Blue Jays in the 1980 rule 5 draft.George Bell at Baseball Reference * December 22, 1980: Del Unser was signed as a free agent by the Phillies.Del Unser at Baseball Reference * March 1, 1981: Randy Lerch was traded by the Phillies to the Milwaukee Brewers for Dick Davis.Dick Davis at Baseball Reference == Regular season == * April 29, 1981: Phillies pitcher Steve Carlton struck out Tim Wallach of the Montreal Expos for the 3000th strikeout of his career.Steve Carlton | The Baseball Page * August 10, 1981: First Baseman Pete Rose hits his 3,631st hit of his career, passing Stan Musial to become the all-time hit leader in the National League. === Season standings === ===Record vs. opponents=== === Notable transactions === * June 8, 1981: Vince Coleman was drafted by the Phillies in the 20th round of the 1981 Major League Baseball draft, but did not sign.Vince Coleman at Baseball Reference *
